dmca.title: Hollywood Camera puts DVD copier in its sights
dmca.body:
Dear Google DMCA Department,

As described in our email conversation with you, our company sells a single product, Hollywood Camera Work, which is a DVD set of video-training. Recently, under the search term "hollywood camera work", a DVD-RIP of our product has appeared on the first page of search-listings, providing anyone with minimal computer-skills access to an illegal download of our product, using the primary search-term one would use to search for us (our product/company name).

We are simultaneously an AdWords advertiser, so a user simply has to decide to click our AdWords link to acquire the product legally, or click the infringer's link to download it illegally.

Search query: "hollywood camera work"
Infringing webpage: lib.verycd.com/2005/05/21/0000051218.html

Our product can be found at http://www.hollywoodcamerawork.us

We have contacted the infringer at [Private]@verycd.com. Our request to them has been to cease and desist any access to illegal download of our product. We have not received a response in approx. 2 weeks.

Our request to Google is to remove this link in the search-index to a DVD-RIP of our product.

We may be contacted at [Private]@hollywoodcamerawork.us, attn. [Private], by phone at [Private], or by fax [Private].

As the sole copyright holder on this product, I have a good faith belief that use of the copyrighted materials described above on the allegedly infringing webpages is not authorized by the copyright owner, its agent, or the law.

I swear, under penalty of perjury consistent with United States Code Title 17, Section 512, that the information in the notification is accurate and that I am the copyright owner or am authorized to act on behalf of the owner of an exclusive right that is allegedly infringed.

Sincerely,
[Private]
Hollywood Camera Work
Hollywood Camera Work, LLC - [Private]- Burbank, CA 91501
Phone: [Private} - Fax: [Private] - Email: [private]@hollywoodcamerawork.us
